text:

Key Takeaways:
1ï¸âƒ£ specify how many logos you want in a sheet
2ï¸âƒ£ The machine can be easily distracted by other words, do not use add too many details (less than 12 words expecting parameters)
3ï¸âƒ£ If there are multiple logos, the models can also combine them together
4ï¸âƒ£ Emojiâ€™s color and shape can influence the results. But for color, it is better to specify it using words

title: The Secret of AI Generated LOGO: Emoji (2)
text:
Welcome!
In the last post, we discussed many tips about using emoji to generate LOGO. Today, we will see how adjectives and sequence of emoji influence the generated image.

title: The Secret of AI Generated LOGO: Emoji (2)
section: Adding adjectives to emoji
text:
Adding adjectives to emoji
Prompt: â˜•ï¸handsomeğŸ‘¨â­•ï¸, 4 separate vector logos, simple, Wolfman Coffee, white background
Output: 
It works! But maybe it is because handsome is used for describing man.
â€“ Every word in the prompt can tell the model what should be included. Like Wolfman contains â€˜Wolfâ€™, so there will be element about wolf. Handsome, similarly, it is used for describing man, so there will be man.
â€“ using adjective that is mainly used for one object can works really well
ğŸš© ROUND 2-
I am trying to add very general adjectives to emoji and see how it goes. See this logo for bookstore. It make me think about â€˜inspiringâ€™ â€˜knowledgeableâ€™

Prompt: inspiringğŸ“–, 4 separate vector logos, simple, add text: Cool Book, white background
OutPut: 
Prompt: knowledgeable ğŸ“–, 4 separate vector logos, simple, add text: Cool Book, white background
Output: 
â€“ It really gets the meaning of adjective and successfully adds it to the emoji it!!!! Surprisingly!

title: The Secret of AI Generated LOGO: Emoji (2)

text:
The sequence of emoji in the prompt

Output: 
Prompt: â˜•ï¸ğŸ‘¨â­•, 4 separate vector logos, simple, Wolfman Coffee, white background

â€“ Compare these two, I found that circle in the logo can be more invisible when â­• is put on the first place
ğŸš© ROUND 3-
How about change ğŸ‘¨ to the first? I wonder wheather there will be wolf again? Prompt: ğŸ‘¨â˜•ï¸â­•, 4 separate vector logos, simple, Wolfman Coffee, white background
Output:  â€“ Yes! The first emoji, which is a man, is very salient and noticeable in the picture.

title: The Secret of AI Generated LOGO: Emoji (2)
section: ğŸ”šConclusion: How to use emoji effectively in LOGO design? (2)
text:
ğŸ”šConclusion: How to use emoji effectively in LOGO design? (2)
Key Takeaways:
1ï¸âƒ£ adding adjective(s) in front of the emoji. As for adjective, the more specific to objects you want, the better.
2ï¸âƒ£ If you want the shape of the logo be more invisible, make it become the last emoji in your prompt, vise versa.
3ï¸âƒ£ If you want the element be more salient in the logo , make it become the last emoji in your prompt, vise versa.

section: Compare prompts with words and prompts with emojis!
text:
Compare prompts with words and prompts with emojis!
ğŸ“’ Note: We use DALLÂ·E 3!!
ğŸ”´ Prompts with only words Prompt: books, 4 logos, color, vector, add text: mapwithmind, simple, white background

Response from GPT: create an image containing four books spaced evenly on a plain white background. Each book should be depicted with a unique logo on its cover, with the logos being simple and designed in a vector style. Each logo should feature a different splash of color. Overlay the text â€˜mapwithmindâ€™ on the image.
ğŸ”º Prompts with emojis Prompt: ğŸ“š, 4 logo, color, vector, add text: mapwithmind, simple, white background

ğŸ‘‰ DALLÂ·E 3 understands words better than emojis: In the response for Prompts with emojis, it even does not mention books!!
But for Prompts with only words, both the background and the logos are related to books!

title: Is AI an excellent artist in terms of color?
section: Color Theory
text:
Color Theory
Color theory can help artist to find the perfect color combination that just seem to work every time.
There are many color wheels, and we choose to use The Traditional Color Wheel.

Some main concepts in Color Theory:
ğŸ”´ Monochromatic color:
Take one basic color, monochromatic colors the colors that are similar to the basic color.
For example, pinkâ€™s monochromatic colors include:

ğŸŸ© Complimentary colors:
Complimentary colors the colors that in the opposite side in the color wheel.
For example, pinkâ€™s monochromatic colors include green:

title: Is AI an excellent artist in terms of color?
section: ğŸ”š Conclusion
text:

Go back to our question: Does AI understand color theory?
The answer is:
NO ğŸ™…â€â™‚ğŸ™…â€â™€ (At least for Gemini on Feb 11, 2024)

title: About
text:
Hey there! ğŸ‘‹ Iâ€™m Simin Liu, an exchange student at the University of Pennsylvania and a student at Hong Kong Baptist University. ğŸ“
